qas.question: When did a PBS documentary air about the Bronx's music history?
What PBS documentary covered the Bronx's music history?

answers.text: "From Mambo to Hip Hop: A South Bronx Tale"

qas.question: Where did DJ Kool Herc hold parties?
Who produced 'From Mambo To Hip Hop'?

answers.text: just north of the Cross Bronx Expressway and hard along the Major Deegan Expressway

context: The Bronx's evolution from a hot bed of Latin jazz to an incubator of hip hop was the subject of an award-winning documentary, produced by <a3_0>City Lore<a3_0/> and broadcast on PBS in <a0_0>2006<a0_0/>, <a1_0>"From Mambo to Hip Hop: A South Bronx Tale"<a1_0/>. Hip Hop first emerged in the South Bronx in the early 1970s. The New York Times has identified <a2_0>1520 Sedgwick Avenue<a2_0/> "an otherwise unremarkable high-rise <a4_0>just north of the Cross Bronx Expressway and hard along the Major Deegan Expressway<a4_0/>" as a starting point, where DJ Kool Herc presided over parties in the community room.
